page.title: 04SIXTH FORMERS' VIEWS
page.content:
At one Chaddesden{secondary school} there is a very small sixth form. These 16 to 18 year old students expressed their views.
They felt that they had too many free periods at school and often spent these in town. They enjoyed being treated more like adults by school staff and had a relaxed atmosphere in their own common room.
They felt that A level study was considerably harder than previous school work because of finding time to do the required reading.
Most of the sixth formers had a Saturday job but none of them had made a decision about a job or further study after school.
